To display the items in a widget with a next button, you can use a `ListView` widget. The `ListView` widget allows you to display a list of items in a scrollable list. You can use the `List.get` method to get the last item in the list and display it initially. Then, you can use a `Button` widget with a `onPressed` callback to trigger the display of the next item in the list when the button is clicked.

Here is an example of how you can use the `ListView` and `Button` widgets to display a list of items with a next button:
```
class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  final List<String> items;

  MyWidget({this.items});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text('My Widget'),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemCount: items.length,
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return ListTile(
            title: Text(items[index]),
          );
        },
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: () {
          // Display the next item in the list
          setState(() {
            items.insert(items.length, 'Next Item');
          });
        },
        child: Icon(Icons.arrow_forward),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
In this example, the `MyWidget` class has a `ListView.builder` widget that displays each item in the `items` list as a `ListTile` widget. The `FloatingActionButton` widget has an `onPressed` callback that inserts the string "Next Item" at the end of the `items` list when the button is clicked. This will cause the `ListView.builder` to display the next item in the list.
